title: This has to be the worst community in gaming
body:
I feel like this game is terrible for ones mental health.  It is a fun game that can be slightly addicting, yet the community has to be the worst in any game I have ever played. You just get these super toxic people who have no idea what they are doing. I am gold iii on an alt account and i create a new account to duo with a friend who is getting back into league. First game in my provisionals some guy trolls and decides to Soraka Jungle, K, quick 18 minute loss. Next game up against a panth+rengar bot lane. Easy right? Well top lane (teemo) loses to Yi  top lane so mid flames and they both rage afk type at each other. OK...next game..velkoz jungle, yas support, with malphite adc..(dodged). Reque  user 1 wants to be mid, but user 2 denies that request. So user 1 bans his champ and picks adc and runs mid all game. Did not dodge because I already dodged once. I mean even on my main account it is the same type of shit. It seems like Gold and below is a bunch of little ragey pre-teens and RIOT DOES NOTHING! But let me drop an F bomb to tell the two ragey kids to Shut the F$%^ up i get slapped with a 10 chat ban, not to mention those who "soft feed" get no penalties. "its hard to tell if someone is feeding." Multi Million dollar company, create a division that investigates inting reports that requires watching video and identifying play patterns. its not hard. I think I am going on another 4 month break from this game. Gives me headaches.

P.S. before people dismiss my claims due to my username, it is supposed to be facetious as I do not flame at all.

its not the players its the gAME

No, it's definitely the players...mainly...but the way the case is presented is rather unfair.

There are plenty of bad eggs, and that's to be expected in a F2P game. Especially with people like T1 [pre-reform] (meaning, especially people who can just continue to create multiple accounts, get multiple accounts permabanned, and still continue the cycle without caring about the consequences)

It being the game refers to things like their bots taking care of the report system not being able to differentiate certain aspects such as 4-mans report stacking their rando when they lose...or having a lot of bugs or server issues...or literally everything to do with f- -king Kai'Sa.

The players don't make those decisions. But in the event of having a 4 man who report stacks their rando when they lose, or people who find and constantly exploit an in-game bug knowing full-well it's not how the game's intended to be played, or deciding to one trick a champion with 0 counterplay potential past lv 11...those are all community (player) issues.

(If you can't tell, I hate Kai'Sa... :P )

you could be right in free to play being a factor.  but in my opinion the most toxic thing about this game is the inability to leave.

i play a lot of CoD and i sometimes get pretty mad playing it.  i often will get frustrated and pissed at the way my team is playing or how the enemy team is playing.  but there is an instant cure for my frustrations in that game.  i turn off my ps4.  and it is almost instant relief.

when i get frustrated and upset in LoL there is no relief.  i am stuck with these teammates or enemies who are making me suffer for sometimes 45+ minutes.  so i reach the point where im not having fun anymore and i am still trapped in that frustration for a very long time.  no escape.

then my rage builds and builds and sometimes i lash out with toxicity at the other players.  this NEVER happens to me in CoD.  because it is only a thing in this game.  the game itself has a toxic design.  

players who are toxic in this game are very often not a problem in other games they play.  that is proof that the game is what causes these players to be toxic.

PS - i hate kai'sa too

That's a very fair statement: you definitely have nailed the issue in the fact that you get punished all the same for attempting to remove yourself from a toxic situation. Obviously, they have a reason for doing that: leavers are an almost guaranteed game loss.

That's one of those slippery-slope arguments, because saying that riot should remove that feature of punishing leavers will result in constant leavers, but there's obviously an issue in being unable to remove yourself from a situation before becoming the same as the people you've got an issue with.

My suggestion would be to further reduce the timer for surrender to 10 minutes. While at 10m, I completely agree with riot that its too damn early to call the game, toxic people have already made up their minds, and people wanting out of the game with those people are...well...wanting out of the game with those people. 10 minutes is about the average amount of time it takes for toxic people to peak in their toxicity, as well as about the average time that their victims are most tempted to become villains by fighting back.

My main was perma'd essentially from exactly the issue you're talking about, so believe me, I feel you. But I firmly believe that the people are the issue. It's not Riot's job to make everyone get along. It's their job to make a game, and to make sure that people aren't intentionally throwing it to ruin the fun and the chances for their teammates, which is not quite the same.

yeah man i dont think it is riot's fault.  they have created a great game but it is also a toxic game.  

i agree with you i dont really see a good solution to leavers.  it would be really bad if players could leave the game too.  it would end up being like 5 vs 2 in like half of the games. 

so yeah they are probably doing the right thing not allowing people to leave.  but it doesnt change the fact that being stuck in a frustrating situation for 20 minutes is extremely toxic.  it is just the way the game is.  the game is toxic.

and thats before we even start to talk about snowballing, autofill, demoting, etc.  there are multiple factors built into the game that cause extreme distress to players.  it is a toxic game before you even add the other players.

So, you want Riot to create an entire division to investigate punishment cases?

You remember this thing called the Tribunal? Lets be generous and say thousands of players participated in this. It got backlogged by months. Now lets add in the lowest cost for just 1k employees to do this. Federal minimum wage in the US is $7.25. Assume 40 hour work week

1000 × 40 = 40,000
40,000 × 7.25 = 290,000 week
52 weeks in a year;
52 × 290,000 = 15,080,000 a year

15,080 per person per year. Even assuming they went 30k salary per person and got 50 hours of work out of a person. That would still be 30m a year.

For a single region.

1. The worst gaming community was, is, and probably will be for awhile, the CoD community. NEVER IN MY LIFE have I heard so many ragey 10 year olds with mics screaming til my ears bled about absolute nonsense.

2. If you don't flame at all, your word choice of telling people to stfu when their argument doesn't involve you, then getting upset over getting bit in the ass for sticking your ass where it didn't belong, sort of fits the bill. Not that I'm one to talk, but at least I will admit that if I'm in chat fighting my team, they've more than likely earned it, and I probably wont feel bad.

3. It IS hard to tell inting from having a really bad game in some situations...like my most recent, super embarrassing Fizz game where I thought I could fight Akali and ended up spending more time dead than alive. Not from inting, but from getting pretty much constantly destroyed by this guy and his jungler at every point of the game. Fizz is not fun to play when shut down. But I will admit that it certainly LOOKS like I was trying to feed...that's probably one of my worst games and highest death counts since I was a literal noob.

4. Meta-breaking is not an instant loss, and people who get instantly tilted when they see someone else pick an off-meta champ for their role are imo incapable of handling competitive play, because they're too busy being unaccepting of their team comp to play their own game properly.

The people in this community are so wrapped up in themselves that they dont see thier teammates unless they want someone to throw under the bus. They spend more time talking about how "gold/diamond" they are than actually playing. 
They dont want to help players (as I have seen on other low-level accounts) these people are so full on themselves they will flame degrade and insult players for "first time"ing a champion. 
Got a champ you never played before? ok. Go 0/3...0/6 on new champ you know NOTHING ABOUT? Well time to label you an Inter, spread it through the community and make sure everyone is blindly against you right from the start. 

Everyone thinks they are "gods gift to league", and people say "just mute all" 
and yet when you DO mute all, you get "Report X for not communicating with thier team"
Oh and lets not forget the "I wont flame" flamers. "Dont mute me, I wont flame you" 
and yet the moment they think they are muted they will throw every offensive name, every zero tolerance trigger word at you just to make sure you know that they wont flame you. Sometimes they even store it all up so that they can unload on you in the post-game lobby. 
Yeah I actively advice people away from league, and when this game finally dies I can move on to something else. 
A great game, but the communities sense of "better than thou" is what makes this game too toxic and hateful to reccommend. 
Good luck bragging how "Trash" your team is when you cant find a team, and the teams you DO find want NOTHING TO DO WITH YOU!.
